Thank you so much for the very good treatment 
Thank you for the chocolate you brought me in my Birthday
reviews.title: Excellent camp in Dahab

reviews.text: Nice location, great service and lovely people. Very cosy and peaceful place. The weather is very hot during summer so better have an conditioned room. But in winter it's simply perfect. The beach is very nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.text:
The rooms are simple with basic facilities, very good compared with price.
Staff is very helpful, always seeking for customers' satisfaction even in activities outside the camp.
The only disadvantage is the cleanness of the shared bathrooms.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.text: The room was clean and had a working ac and minibar, free wifi is also available. The stuff is so friendly and the location is great, highly recommend it.. the price was also so good .. the only bad side was the we could not use the kitchen as it's for stuff only
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text:
Perfect location just in front of the sea and near to the city, the stuff is friendly, and Huda the manager was very helpful
my room was with a separate bathroom and it was fine with a AC and a small fridge, just it wasn't clean enough
reviews.title: Cheap with friendly and helpful Stuff

reviews.text: the room was equipped with a working AC and private  bathroom,clean sheets and two comfy beds...the staff was nice and helpful..it became one of my favorite places in dahab...the place is near to the center of the city(which is not big anyways), but it's near to all the local restaurants and the diving centers..it's a 10 mins walk from the lighthouse if you are familiar with dahan..and a local bar/pub called nessima bar is just behind it.
reviews.title: Simple,inexpensive and satisfactory

name: Safir Dahab Resort
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.

reviews.text:
An amazing hotel in every way. The architecture is really beautiful and the landscaped grounds. It has a huge pool which will soon be heated but was usable in March. The location is excellent as its on a sandy beach with all the watersports nearby and its own Padi diving centre.  You can also book trips to diving and snorkelling sites and St Catherines etc in the kiosk on the hotel beach where you will meet the very lovely Amany. 
It's a  5 minute taxi ride to town where you can find lots of great little shops and restaurants.  Dahab is a laid back place where you will feel very safe  and you dont get more than a friendly approach from people who would like you to look in their shop or visit their restaurant.  Its very low hassle

The hotel breakfast had a vast choice and was delicious, the dinner was also very good. Only the buffet restaurant was open but they are opening more restaurants and a beautiful disco soon.  The prices for drinks and food are very reasonable compared to other hotels we have been to in Egypt. 

We had a deluxe double room with the most comfortable bed I have every had in a hotel with lovely Egyptian cotton bedlinen . The shower was walk in and spotless and our room was kept beautiful every day by the wonderful Hesham who left us many fabulous towel art sculptures. 

Although its a beautiful hotel , the staff are what make it really great. I felt like they were like my Egyptian family by the end of our stay.  Too many to mention everyone but so many thanks to Sherin in reception, the Bell Captain Mr Ahmed, Mr Happy, Gamil , Ibrahim and all the dining room staff, Koka in the beach bar who was so friendly and delightful every day ( ask her for the special Koka Moka Mocktail) . Also to Shenoudah and Joseph in the bar , Mr Hany for so much help with room booking and other organisation, Guest Relations, especially the lovely Nesma and finally, my good friends Ibrahim, Neder and Mohamed who looked after us on the beach.  Thank you all for helping me with my Arabic lessons and being such lovely people. 

Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough .
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back. Thoroughly recommended.

reviews.text: It was enjoyable staying in Safir hotel Dahab. The room was comfort, clean and well arranged every day. The public areas are well maintained. The stuff is helpful with smile and care. The room safe was bad and a fully correction was made in minutes. The restaurant is full of  variety delicious   breakfast and dinner food and helpful waiters. I would like to thanks mrs' Shirin Samir from the reception for here hospitality during our stay. I would like also to thank the room cleaning guy whom we did not see but we felt his good work every day.
reviews.title: Great. See you soon

reviews.text:
The hotel site was perfect everything was very clean the resturant chefs are highly professional especially the desert chef as be made to us special orders 
The cons first was the beach bar as they are not flexible with us always want to stick to timmings 
Secondly you need to fix your regulations about the all inclusive rules as they always control everything with timmings if crossing the time adjusted you have to pay charge for example the icecream only free from 4pm till5pm before 4pm its charged after 5pm the resturant is closed so where is the inclusive in that😀
reviews.title: Great site but not all inclusive as it mentioned

owner_response.text:

About the beach use cost in the first day we set it as a complimentary for you although the camera records showed that she stayed the night with you but she was most welcome.
In the third day we had to assure with you the cost for the beach use and this is according to our hotel policy.
I hope that you enjoyed our hotel facility and outlets and we are looking forward welcoming you again soon
(Best regards)(Management team)

reviews.text:
if you really want to feel Dahab Vibes, ElRayga is the place , its not just a camp , its fully equipped camp if your solo traveler or with friends, they have many room options, private and shared, i was in a hut as in the photo , its very safe i didn't even have to close the door while i was away, the staff if incredibly friendly and helpful,

The shard WC and kitchen is very clean and convenient, the rooms are very clean and beds are very comfy, very hospital and the vibs is amazing in this place, i have checked more than 30 resorts, camps , hotels at Dahab, and i found Elrayga have the best Value / money / Vibs in the town.

The also Organize trips so you will have every thing u need in the place. The location is very unique its very close to El mamsha, and the sea and the main road.

Thank you For ElRayga team and management for keeping it the way it is.

Special thanks to Mr Emad: El Rayga owner, Mr Farghaly camp manager , Mr Anas and Mr Nouby from the reception team,

Mr Mohamed, Mr Aly, Mr Ahmed and Mr Malek , and every one else i my for get to mention.

i had the best 2 weeks every in my life with you guys. thank you soo much <3
reviews.title: i had the best 2 weeks every in my life with you guys. thank you soo much <3

reviews.text: The most beautiful and Cozy camp in Dahab with a great location and service , the rooms clean with bathroom and air condition also there is tents , kitchen available if you like to cook and the place is very safe
reviews.title: Fabulous camp

reviews.text:
We had actualy booked with another Camp which was a massive disappointment on so many levels. So we searched for an alternative and got the Crazy Camel Camp recommended by a friend. We arranged a meeting to see the rooms at night and were welcomed righ away. I immediately loved it, so we stayed the rest of our days in Dahab there. 

It´s just lovely. The rooms are bright and very clean. As we stayed there with our dog, we especially loved the terrace and also the open yard, where our dog socialized with the resident dogs and lay in the sun. There are also multiple tables outside in sun or shade to sit and enjoy your time . If we ever needed anything there was always someone to ask. For example: as there were heavy rains the night we wanted t leave in the morning, our bus company told us that they would leave Dahab in the afternoon at 3pm. We asked if we could stay in the room a bit longer instead of checking out at 12, which would have been the rule and it was no problem at all.

The camp is perfectly located directly at the promenade. The first snorkel spot (getting in the water at the bridge) is just 3 minutes away. You cans stroll the promenade for food or find some cheaper options a bit away from the shore, nothing being far away. 

We would always stay there again and highly recommend the place!
reviews.title: Clean, bright, calm, friendly!

reviews.text: We wre diving with Scuba Seekers, so it made sense to stay in the CCC as it is right next door. Accomodation was fairly basic but had all the essentials - comfortable beds, decent bathroom etc. Our only complaint was that it was pretty darn cold at night and the rooms have no heating but they do provide sufficient bedding but that's no consolation for a late-night nip to the en-suite!
reviews.title: Basic but decent accomodation

reviews.text:
Wer eine einfache, ruhige und saubere Oase mitten im Herzen von Dahab sucht, wird hier fündig. Familiäre Atmosphäre. Grosszügige Zimmer mit frisch renoviertem Bad. 50 m zum Strand, Tauchschulen und Restaurants in unmittelbarer Nähe. Es werden hier tolle Kamelsafaris in Wüste Sinai organisiert! Preis, - Leistungsverhälnis passt absolut. 
Immer wieder gerne. ☺️
reviews.title: Empfehlung!

reviews.text:
Very nice hotel infect it's like an apartment with 2 bedroom, living room and kitchen with kitchenets. Location is great - beach and restaurants are nearby.

They have to work on bathrooms as we needed to mob to clear the water.
reviews.title: Good apartment and location

reviews.text:
My girlfriend and I had a wonderful week at "the Castle", but it was not the main building. It is called "Villa 22" and it also belongs to Ali, who was a very helpful and nice host. Everything was clean and the suite has enough space to work with two notebooks.
All in all I highly recommend this place and the people working here and it has a very good priceperformance. I will definitely come again if I will go to Dahab.
Thank you very much for everything Ali!
KR
Maria & Stephan
reviews.title: Nice suite, good location, very good host

reviews.text: We stayed at the Castle 2, it’s 200m from the Castle. Very beautiful new building, has amazing rooftop. We had a room with queen bed, kitchen and bathroom. It was new clean and comfortable. Mr Ali is very friendly and helpful, he helped us with taxi and our luggage. And it was just nice to have a small talk with him. This made our stay in Dahab very comfortable and relaxing. Totally recommend. Thank you!
reviews.title: Very friendly owner and beautiful comfy rooms

reviews.text: We reserved and a complicated conditions are happen and they took the reservation money despite calling for explanation and corona case and mr ali the manager is so awful person who didn't care for his customers
reviews.title: The worst hotel ever

reviews.text: I have stayed in The Castle for one week and I highly recommend the place. Its very clean, quite and well furnished with air-condition. And the price is resnable. All the Appreciation to Mr. Ali and his staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic place with a resnable price

reviews.text: The Castle is located in a secluded and quiet area that is a walking distance from the main street. Staff is really friendly and helpful. Room amenities exceeded expectations (fridge, stove, hot water, TV). Rooms are really spacious for big groups.
reviews.title: Quiet Comfort

reviews.text: The staff were really nice and helpful. It was great value for money. I enjoyed my stay at Cuba Auski. My tips for helping them to improve would be to keep the shared bathroom facilities a little cleaner.
reviews.title: Nice Staff and easy going place

reviews.text: Unfortunately i didn't stay at the camp because it was fully booked but the staff was very kind to offer me to stay in the plaza and rest from the road , i didn't try the camp but i highly recommend to stay if you looking for something on budget and friendly environment.
reviews.title: Very kind and friendly Crew

reviews.text:
I absolutely LOVED staying at Auski Camp in Dahab. The place has a new owner since around half a year, who improved the place a lot and made this one of the very best options to stay in Dahab! 
The whole resort is beautifully designed in blue and white, has a perfect sitting area in the middle, and cozy rooms meeting everyone‘s needs. There are basic rooms for an unbeatable price (I couldn’t find any cheaper place to stay in the whole time), rooms with AC, group rooms- whatever you need. The toilets are in a good condition and there is hot water 24/7.
The best thing about Auski Camp is the amazing location. You‘re literally in the middle of Mashraba, and you have all the cheap good restaurants of Dahab just one walking minute away. Just outside, you find many shops, a liquor store, taxis, everything you need. I would say that you can’t find a better location in Dahab.
Then, finally, the owner Karim and his worker, Mahmoud, are extremely kind and helpful people, who quickly became friends.
If you‘re searching for an amazing cheap place (also for long-term!), this is it!
reviews.title: Excellent and cheap place to stay in Dahab!

reviews.text:
I usually do not write reviwes, but that experience was so bad, I just have to!

I don´t even know where to start as we are still so perplexed by this extraordinarily bad experience!

Before the travel:
We were travelling with our dog, so we specifically looked for places that would allow a dog. Cuba Auski advertises on the internet with being pet friendly. Due to bad experiences before we still contacted them before booking, specifically mentioning the dog and asking for a good WiFi connection, as we had to do some work there. They said both was fine, so we booked a room with private bathroom, as we are not to keen on sharing bathrooms.
A day before the trip I contacted the host to get a mobile number in case anything would go wrong. First thing I got was a text stating "We have no room with private bathroom available". After making very clear that we booked a private bathroom and expect one, the host eventually confirmed that we would get one.

Checki-In:
When we arrived, we were not put in a room in the Cuba Auski but in a neighbouring camp, which was fine with us, because it actually looked cleaner. Upon arrival they already informed us that we would only stay one day in this room and would have to move again, which we did not like to much but agreed to. However, suddenly our dog was a problem. She was not allowed in that room and they suggested she could just stay outside... with no fences at all and easy access to the street. What?! Of course we did not at all agree. As they did not offer any solution, we demanded our money back and wanted to search for another place. The host tried to trick us into cancelling the reservation on Airbnb, which due to the hosts chosen policy would have left us with no money at all (we had made exactly this experience before in Dahab!). He did not agree to repay usin cash. So they left us hanging there for a while until they managed to give us a room in the Cuba Auski Camp, which was not the room we booked. We figured out in the end that the host probably overbooked his place, asked a neighbouring host for help but did not mention the dog, which turned into a problem. He finally moved someone else out of Cuba Auski so we could get the room there. It seems not to be the first time the host overbooked, reading the reviews here.

The room:
Unfortunately, the host did not take the time to clean the room (not that it would have helped a lot). The sheets were fresh, but that was about it. The room was crammed with three beds and barely enough space to even walk to the bathroom. The floor was not cleaned. There was only a single socket for a three-people-place! Not even enough to recharge everyones phone and for sure not enough to also work a little. The "Workspace" described in the amenities was not there (btw also no towels, toilet paper or soap, as state in the amenities). However, as there was also no functionable WiFi in the room (despite us asking before booking!), working would have been not possible anyways. The bathroom was beyond disgusting! Not only was it NOT cleaned and all the amatures where super rusty, but it also stank terribly. Unfortunately it was also not possible to close the bathroom door so the whole place stank like manure. B.t.w. there was also no handle on the front door, so when it fell shut we had to get help from outside to even leave the room.

Conclusion:
We hated every second there and moved out the next day, even without getting our money back. Please, even if you are financially tight, think about whether what you might save is really worth what you might get there! We ended up in Crazy Camel Camp which was amazing (!) and only few dollars more expensive per night and so worth it. Because, what good is a holiday if you hate being there?
reviews.title: What an aweful sh*thole!

you can open the window, which does not really help with the smell but lets mosquitos in *yeah*

reviews.text:
THIEFS! HIGH ON DRUGS ALL DAY! NEVER STAY THERE.

1) I paid two nights upfront to confirm my reservation, owner called on checking in morning to convince me to get a bed in another hostel as the hotel is OVERBOOKED! I refused and got my room after a fight over the phone.
2) Hygiene is terrible. Bathrooms are unclean with a horrible smell all day.
3) On checking out day, I agreed with the owner to leave my luggage till night. When returning back at 7 PM, he requested a 100 EGP as a cost of a one night stay at a room with a fan! 
NEVER NEVER NEVER STAY THERE.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE CAMP

reviews.text: its very good cozy and friendly place its near to everything in dahab its almost in the center of the city also they organize night parties you will have fun with them for sure but the only bad thing that it doesn't have an private area on sea.
reviews.title: Very good for budget travelers

reviews.text: The Auski camp has a great location, right at the begining of the main pedestrian street. it has it's own restaurant with perfect sea views. The service in general is great. The AC in our room wasn't working, we told the room service about it. They tried to fix it, but couldn't manage to do it before our check-out dates, so they gave us the price of one night back. The restaurant is great and offers food with great quality.
reviews.title: One of the best in Dahab!

reviews.text:
It's a great place if you don't want to pay for more than $15 per night for a double-bed room. The camp is in "Al Mashraba" place, and its in the middle of the market. You have an easy access to nearby restaurants, groceries, and bazars.
They have an outdoor arabian sitting area which overlooks the sea, and the prices of the drinks are very cheap.
The guys there can help you organize any activity you'd like to do.
I highly recommend it to you if you don't want to spend most of your money on a place you only use it for sleeping.
reviews.title: Budget Camp

reviews.text: Auski camp has been in Dahab for many years and if the palms could talk I'm sure they would have some great stories to share. It is well located and the rooms are cheap and clean. Good for those wanting to stay a long time and really enjoy the dahab vibe. The main sitting area is where I have met some of my closest friends from all parts of the world- a travellers haven! The owner and staff are always willing to help out and organise trips/diving-you name it!
reviews.title: A long time favourite of travellers

reviews.text: This used to be a very good and clean camp in Dahab. Those photos are part from the Bedouin Restaurant behind. The worst part about staying always here is the management. Always is empty, and when I am going to pay another night..."sorry but we are full tomorrow, we have a reservation for this room you are staying". It is very unreliable. At the time I stayed, they had a French guy doing a lousy job cleaning. Always the toilets and showers were filthy. The claim it WS because they were close to remodeling. I got a very serious burn with the shower. Someone flushed the toilet and the steam bent the PVC pipe in the shower splattering with burning water all my body. It used to be 25 £E per night now is way more. My room, 117 had a gap that I had to sleep with my winter clothes on. It was very cold at night, I would had bought a heater at local Gazala Supermarket, but they kicked me out anyway.
reviews.title: Wiseguys
